channel.title: Java vs C++ vs Python for Games
channel.description:
Should I stick with Java, learn/master C++, or learn/master Python in addition to Java development? I really like Java and have done some development with it, but not enough to kill myself to switch or use both Java and either C++ or Python (I'm not that good at Java :P). I do not have any business, mobile development, website, etc. needs currently. [b]I want to make games.[/b] I want to make games from 2D style to 3D multiplayer games. What would you recommend?
What would you recommend when I do need business, mobile development, website, etc. needs?
Thank you,
TheCyberMan
P.S. I know Java is much slower than C++, but I don't know much about Python.

item.title: Java vs C++ vs Python for Games
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

TheCyberMan:

I want to use a universal language such as the ones I mentioned. C# is a Windows programming language, is it not?

It is not. With the help of Mono, it’s now pretty portable, and while you can still use windows forms, GTK# looks much nicer. Although XNA is still pretty restricting, and I can’t remember the last time anything has been done on MonoXNA.

Read full topic
item.source: Java vs C++ vs Python for Games

item.title: Java vs C++ vs Python for Games
item.dc:creator: @ripzone Triton
item.description:
@ripzone wrote:

Evil_:

Honestly why not go for C#, it’s a pretty nice middleman; XNA is quite nice

Portability could be a problem. There are some ports to other platforms, but AFAIK they’re still incomplete (2D only, etc).

Read full topic
item.source: Java vs C++ vs Python for Games

item.title: Java vs C++ vs Python for Games
item.dc:creator: @MistaBigBoss MistaBigBoss
item.description:
@MistaBigBoss wrote:

[quote=“Evil_, post:4, topic:414998”]Honestly why not go for C#, it’s a pretty nice middleman; XNA is quite nice[/quote]I really love it, started to learn it on highschool recently, and I felt in love with the language.

I’m doing my MMO in C# in Unity though, but C#.

Why Unity? Simple, cross-platform and webplayer.

Read full topic

item.source: Java vs C++ vs Python for Games

item.title: Java vs C++ vs Python for Games
item.dc:creator: @ripzone Triton
item.description:
@ripzone wrote:

There is no right answer to that question. Pretty much all of them will have problems. I’d say if you just want to do 2D games, then stay with Java or Python. If you want 3D, C++ or Java is your best bet.

Personally I would stay away from dynamic scripting languages for the base of your game. I would use a statically typed compiled language for the base, like Java, C# or C++. Then if you want you can have some scripting support, either using Python or Lua.

Read full topic
item.source: Java vs C++ vs Python for Games

item.title: Java vs C++ vs Python for Games

Assuming you mean the standard implementations of interpreters for programs written in both languages, you are quite silly.[/quote]What is that answering exactly o.O?

Read full topic
